ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
In the past week, what time have you usually gotten into bed?
In the past week, what time have you usually turned out the light to go to sleep?
In the past week, about how long has it usually taken you to fall asleep?
In the past week, what time have you usually woken up in the morning?
In the past week, what was the earliest time you woke up in the morning from your nighttime sleep?
In the past week, what was the latest time you woke up in the morning from your nightime sleep?
Some people wake up during the night. How many times have you usually woken up during the night in the past week?
Notes: 0 = never; 1 = once; 2 = 2 times; 3 = 3 times; 4 = 4 or more times; 5 = I have no idea; -9 = missing

ElementDescription: Taking all of these awakening together, how much time were you usually awake each night over the past week?
Some people nap in the day. Over the past week, how many naps did you have per day?
Taking all of these naps together, how much time did you nap per day over the past week?
Over the past week, what time did the last nap of the day end?
Regularity Dimension Score
Satisfaction Dimension Score
Alert Dimension Score
Timing Dimension Score
Efficiency Dimension Score
Duration Dimension Score
Sleep Health Composite Score
